//: Every spell that a monster casts are explained here. There's no way of telling you the description in-game, and here we are, reading infos about 'em at this file!

Since monsters can only have one spell in their special attacks (and idk if this is intentional to the devs), I tend to combine them... Combo (combination) spell and a regular one, casted in an instance!
name: Sacrifice
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster deals an instant death damage, sacrificing itself upon casting a spell that's been combined with.'
//: There's a bug in which self-damaging spells are being 'reflected', so we'll use a damaging effect to apply to the caster (the effect requires a turn to apply the damage, and it's a bit unpleasant... but still a backup to prevent overcasting).

name: null
description: null... just ignore this.

name: Summon Tentacles
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster's tentacle outburst sprouts 3 tentacles out of the ground.'

name: Twisted Strike
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster's tentacle outburst pierces the closest target from the caster with compact tentacles, dealing moderate stabbing damage and inflicts unconsciousness for 1 turn.'

name: Tentacle Outburst
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster channels its body for some turns to strike the ground with its tentacles, then bursts violently under the target, dealing stabbing damage and applies an unstable footing that lasts for 3 turns to the affected creatures in its radius.'

name: Pin Missile
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster quickly sways its limb to shoot off needle-like projectiles in a cone, dealing stabbing damage to the targets.'

name: Charging Stance
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster sets itself into guarding stance, blocking physical damage while gaining a burst of speed.'
//: 15 turns duration, to make titans not OP everytime.

name: a spell
description:
Target spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster locks its line of sight onto the target, then casts the Spell(s).'

extra_effects.//: hit_self, so it forces the monster to cast the spell with 0 range value to itself, receiving (de)buff, damage or healing spell effect.

//: Add an effect to spell. Monster won't cast a spell if it doesn't do anything to the target... I think?.
As long as caster sees the target, it will cast (if its not on cooldown, ofc). Nice.
Nice.

name: Acid Burst
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster's acid glob explodes violently, dealing acid damage to all surrounding creatures.'

name: Acid Glob
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster shoots a mouthful of concentrated acid glob to the target, dealing a small acid damage.'

Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:

name: Blood Curl

Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'When the target is nearby, caster manipulates some of the blood wave's blood to stick into the target, applying even more bloodbath. This is casted 3 times.'

name: Blood Wave
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster channels its surrounding blood to strike a large area in a cone, dealing moderate bash damage and applying bloodbath to all affected creatures.'

description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:

description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:

Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:

name: Portal
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:

name: Gravitational Collapse
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'After channeling for a massive amount of time, caster's gravitational force field collapses, creating a supernova, dealing tremendous bash damage to all creatures. Sparkling objects are scattered, which enlightens the area.'
//: Basically, an enemy target has to be the center of explosion, so that Spells get casted successfully.

name: Charge!
description:
Spell casted by a monster. If you're seeing this, then read this one instead:
'Caster gains momentum, increasing movement speed, hit chance and impact damage as it takes effect.'
//: Momentum's a short duration haste, accuracy and bonus bash damage. Max intensity after casting the spell.
Momentum is also a unique stat modifier that differs to the type of charger.
Use field to stun DIRECTLY the PLAYER.
Let's push the charger back from the player. This does work SOMETIMES, and this'll prevent the glitch to occur.

//: The reach of this spell is close to the reality bubble, incase of veinhole dies because of something else.
That being said, the spell is casted by you, and it's a bit unstable (like warnings about casting a spell while you are hurt).
